data.title: Everything We Know About ‘It Ends With Us’ So Far
data.meta_description: Based on the book by Colleen Hoover, It Ends With Us tells the story of Lily Bloom and Ryle Kincaid with stars like Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni.
data.text:
The cinematic adaptation of It Ends With Us is set to bloom later this summer, and the trailer for the Sony Pictures film, directed by Justin Baldoni and adapted from Colleen Hoover’s best-selling novel, racked up a record number of views in the first 24 hours after it debuted.

Starring Blake Lively, who also executive produces, as protagonist Lily Bloom, the clip, set to Taylor Swift’s “My Tears Ricochet” shows Lily ecstatic to open her flower shop in Boston, with Jenny Slate’s character Alyssa turning on the neon sign. Alyssa is related to Baldoni’s Ryle Kincaid, who stops by the shop and sparks a connection with Lily. Lily has a traumatic past, but reminders of her parents’ relationship surface in Ryle’s behavior as well as her reconnection with ex-boyfriend Atlas Corrigan (Brandon Sklenar).

Those curious about the rest of the It Ends with Us cast, the film’s plot, the book it is based on and the author can read on for details.

What is It Ends With Us about?

Hoover’s novel tells the story of Lily Bloom, a girl who has just graduated college and moved to Boston to start a new chapter of her life. When she meets Ryle, a neurosurgeon finishing his residency there, the two gravitate toward each other. Ryle doesn’t want to be distracted by a relationship, but Lily isn’t looking for something casual, so she becomes the exception to Ryle’s rule.

As they forge a relationship, Lily’s firs love Atlas Corrigan (Brandon Sklenar) resurfaces in Boston and brings up her traumatic past. Hoover mentioned on Instagram when she announced the casting of Lily and Ryle that the book was loosely inspired by her mother, who made the decision to get Hoover and her family out of a “scary situation” and brought them to Hoover’s childhood home which she showed in the video. Lily’s past trauma revolves around her parents’ relationship.

Who is in the It Ends With Us cast?

Blake Lively stars as the film’s central character Lily Bloom. Justin Baldoni, who directed the film, also stars as Ryle Kincaid. Brandon Sklenar (1923) plays Atlas Corrigan. Jenny Slate plays Allyssa, and Hasan Minaj will portray Marshall. Alex Neustaedter and Isabela Ferrer will portray the younger versions of Atlas Corrigan and Lily Bloom, respectively.

RELATED: Blake Lively & Justin Baldoni Romance ‘It Ends With Us’ Will Now Begin In Early August

When does It Ends With Us come out?

Originally slated to come out early in 2024, the romantic drama film has since shifted release dates twice due to delays in production from the dual Hollywood strike in the summer of 2023. It was pushed to June 2024, and then to its now most current release date: August 9.

As they forge a relationship, Lily’s first love Atlas Corrigan (Brandon Sklenar) resurfaces in Boston and brings up her traumatic past. Hoover mentioned on Instagram when she announced the casting of Lily and Ryle that the book was loosely inspired by her mother, who made the decision to get Hoover and her family out of a “scary situation” and brought them to Hoover’s childhood home which she showed in the video. Lily’s past trauma revolves around her parents’ relationship.

Is It Ends With Us based on a book?

Yes, the film has been adapted from the best-selling novel by Colleen Hoover.

Is Colleen Hoover involved in the It Ends With Us movie?

Hoover, who wrote the source material, will executive produce alongside Lively.

Does Colleen Hoover have other books?

Yes, Hoover has written many fictional romance novels, and she recently published a prequel companion to It Ends With Us titled It Starts With Us.

Will there be other Colleen Hoover movies?

It Ends With Us is the first of Hoover’s books to be adapted into a film by Sony Picures and Wayfarer Studios.

Alex Saks will produce for Saks Picture Company, along with Jamey Heath, who will produce on behalf of Wayfarer Studios. Lively and Hoover are executive producing along with Steve Sarowitz, Andrew Calof and Baldoni on behalf of Wayfarer, which is also co-financing. Hall is also producing.

The Hollywood Reporter recently broke the news that Amazon MGM will adapt Hoover’s thriller Verity into a film. The suspenseful novel follows writer Lowen Ashleigh, who gets hired by the husband of a best-selling thriller author Verity Crawford to finish a series of novels that Verity cannot complete because of an accident that left her in a comatose state. Based on manuscripts Lowen finds in Verity’s house, she begins to question if Verity’s writing is purely fiction or not.
